questiontext.text:
Let's consider a flat concrete wall of width $$w$$ = 0.10 m and surface area $$S$$ = 20.00 m<sup>2</sup>. The surfaces at $$x$$ = 0 and at $$x = w$$ are maintained at temperatures $$\theta_0$$ = 0.0 °C and $$\theta_w$$ = 20.0 °C. It will be assumed that the heat transfer is in one direction and in steady state, without internal sources and that the thermal conductivity of medium concrete is $$\lambda$$ = 0.50 W/m·K.
**Give the values of:**
$$U$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=5.00:0.5} (±0.5) W/m<sup>2</sup>K, thermal transmittance
$$R$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.010000:0.005} (±0.005) K/W, (absolute) thermal resistance,
$$\varphi_{0,w}$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=-100.00:10} (±10) W/m<sup>2</sup>, heat flux from $$x$$ = 0 to $$x = w$$,
$$q_{0,w}$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=-2000.00:100} (±100) W, heat transfer rate from $$x$$ = 0 to $$x = w$$.

Let's consider a flat concrete wall of width $$w$$ = 0.10 m and surface area $$S$$ = 20.00 m<sup>2</sup>. The surfaces at $$x$$ = 0 and at $$x = w$$ are maintained at temperatures $$\theta_0$$ = 0.0 °C and $$\theta_w$$ = 20.0 °C. It will be assumed that the heat transfer is in one direction and in steady state, without internal sources and that the thermal conductivity of medium concrete is $$\lambda$$ = 1.00 W/m·K.
**Give the values of:**
$$U$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=10.00:0.5} (±0.5) W/m<sup>2</sup>K, thermal transmittance
$$R$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.005000:0.005} (±0.005) K/W, (absolute) thermal resistance,
$$\varphi_{0,w}$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=-200.00:10} (±10) W/m<sup>2</sup>, heat flux from $$x$$ = 0 to $$x = w$$,
$$q_{0,w}$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=-4000.00:100} (±100) W, heat transfer rate from $$x$$ = 0 to $$x = w$$.
